name: Moss Lurker
description: The Moss Lurker is a small humanoid creature adept at utilizing natural cover to surprise enemies in wooded areas. It possesses distinct red claws and has a forest camouflaged appearance.
memorable: Notable for its ability to poison food and strike from hiding, it's a crafty ambusher in forested environments.
goals: Prefers to ambush prey and protect its territory in the forest.
relations: Can be encountered alongside other forest-dwelling creatures or as part of a group of lurking ambushers.
strengths: Excels in stealth and has a high capability to poison targets.
weaknesses: Less effective in open terrains and can be vulnerable to stronger foes despite its moderate durability.
attacks: Attacks with a poisoned claw, dealing both slashing and poison damage, or throws stones for bludgeoning damage.
most_powerful_ability: Poisoned Gifts allows it to contaminate food or drink, potentially rendering foes unconscious if they fail a saving throw.
senses: Possesses blindsight up to 60 feet, allowing it to perceive its environment without sight.
skills: Skilled in Stealth with a +4 bonus, making it difficult to detect, and proficient in ambushing.
additional_information: Immune to poison damage and the poisoned condition.
Has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks in forested terrain.
Gains advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks related to hearing or smell.
Can deal extra damage by throwing stones from elevation.
Challenge rating of 1 makes it a manageable threat for lower-level adventurers.
